Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery floral band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: in handle zone, band of incised palmettes with added red on hearts and alternate fronds and faded added white dots around hearts, separated by single palmette fronds; below, broad black band, reserved band and part of further glazed area.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels, see Vierneisel, K. and Kaeser, B., Kunst der Schale. Kultur des Trinkens. Munich 1990, 36, fig. 2.24 and 2.25.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0474) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
